case_vignette:
A 24-year-old man is brought to the doctor’s office by his mother because the patient believes aliens have begun to read his mind and will soon have him performing missions for them. The patient’s mother says that the delusions have been intermittently present for periods of at least 1-month over the past year. When he is not having delusions, she says he still lacks expression and has no interest in socializing with his friends or going out. He has no past medical history and takes no prescription medications. The patient has smoked 1 pack of cigarettes daily for the past 10 years. Since the disturbance, he has not been able to maintain employment and lives at home with his mother. His vitals include: blood pressure 124/82 mm Hg, pulse 68/min, respiratory rate 14/min, temperature 37.3°C (99.1°F). On physical examination, the patient exhibits poor eye contact with a flat affect. His speech is circumferential, land he is currently experiencing bizarre delusions. The results from a urine drug screen are shown below:
Amphetamine negative
Benzodiazepine negative
Cocaine negative
GHB negative
Ketamine negative
LSD negative
Marijuana negative
Opioids negative
PCP negative
question: Which  is the correct diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I believe that aliens are reading my mind and will soon make me do missions for them.
Do you have any other symptoms like changes in sleep, mood, or behavior?
I've been feeling a lack of emotion and no interest in hanging out with my friends or going out even when I'm not thinking about aliens.
How long have you been experiencing these thoughts and feelings?
I've been having these thoughts and feelings on and off for at least a month over the past year.
Have you ever had any similar thoughts or feelings in the past or received any psychiatric care?
I have no past medical history and take no prescription medications.
Have you experienced any significant stressors or life changes recently?
I've not been able to keep a job and am living at home with my mother because of these issues.
Does anyone in your family have a history of mental illness or psychiatric conditions?
I don't have any medical knowledge to share about my family's medical history.
Have you used any substances such as drugs or alcohol that might contribute to your symptoms?
I smoke a pack of cigarettes every day for the past 10 years, but I haven't had any alcohol or drugs according to a recent test.
Have you been experiencing any unusual perceptual experiences, such as hearing voices or seeing things that others do not see?
I have not mentioned experiencing hearing voices or seeing things that others do not see.
Has your concentration or memory been affected recently?
I haven't mentioned any issues with my concentration or memory.
Final Diagnosis: Schizotypal Personality Disorder

trial_0.summarized_conversation: A patient present to the clinic with concerns about feeling like aliens are reading their mind and will soon make them do missions for them. The patient has been experiencing a lack of emotion and no interest in socializing for at least a month over the past year. The patient has no past medical history and does not take any prescription medications. The patient has had difficulty keeping a job and is living at home with their mother. The patient reports smoking a pack of cigarettes every day for the past 10 years, but has not used alcohol or drugs according to a recent test. There is no mention of experiencing hearing voices or seeing things that others do not see, and no issues with concentration or memory have been mentioned.
trial_0.singleturn_frq: **Final Diagnosis:** Psychotic Disorder (Delusional Disorder or Schizophrenia Spectrum Disorder)

These thoughts have been happening on and off for at least a month over the past year.
